website_summaries.verdict: A wonderful option for families wanting a pogo jumper specifically made for toddlers and small children.
pros: Available for purchase in a number of different color options and styles
Squeaker built into base of pogo jumper
cons: Many buyers complain that the squeaking can get annoying, but kids appreciate it nonetheless

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Fun - See Video
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for my 4-year-old. Her first attempt or two, she could not get her balance, but once she figured it out, she was good to go. Yes, it squeaks when jumping but it doesn't bother me. She is so happy doing it. Her just turned two 2-year-old brother loves watching her. He gave it a shot once but, obviously, couldn't get balanced. We've had it less than a week, but so far, it's been totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: KLB81

customer_reviews.title: Squeak Squeak Silence
customer_reviews.text: Very cute toy. Beware it does squeak by design. Very annoying but kids love it. Lots of joy for one day. After that the squeak went out. Kids were sad. Parents were happy.
customer_reviews.author: designermom cheri-j

customer_reviews.title: For kids, and kids at heart!
customer_reviews.text: Since it holds up to 250 lbs, I had to give it a go without the fear of breaking it. It was so much fun!! My son opened it on Christmas and he had as much fun as I did. We both give it 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Red67Stang

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 3 (almost 4) year old. Lots of falls but he's having a great time with it! As with all toys this one has been used in his pretending. It's been a vacuum, a fishing pole, a motorcycle handle while he sits on a bar stool... so not only is This great for indoor/outdoor bouncing it's easily used in imaginative play. Money well spent, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: S. J.

customer_reviews.title: Indoor/Outdoor Fun
customer_reviews.text: My six year old grandson loves it. A fun indoor/outdoor toy, which enables an active child to burn off some energy. The Jumper stores easily in his toy box and is one that should travel well in a suitcase if planning a trip. My grandson received it for Christmas and despite all the other presents he received, this one he played with most on Christmas day. It loses one star because of the squeaking sound it has when used. Doesn't bother the grandson, but can, after a while, be annoying to adult ears.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Fun kid exerciser and bonus dog runner!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super fun! I got it for my barely 5 year old for Christmas and she loves it. It was easy for her to do too, once she figured it out. It gets her energy out and its pretty funny to watch. The squeaky could get annoying for some people, but it gets the dog all riled up too and he chases her all around while my husband I get to sit back and chill. That makes the squeaker more than worth the noise (it's really not that loud). It's a kid exerciser and a dog runner all in one!
customer_reviews.author: M. Mack

customer_reviews.title: Fun but learning curve at first for my 3 yr old
customer_reviews.text: This toy is a blast, my child loves it and so does his grandma. I think she has used it more than him. Pros: It is mostly made of soft materials and so is great indoors. That you can also use it outside. My toddler finds the squeaking noise hilarious and so it makes him want to play with it more. It definitely helps him work on some different motor skills. Folds up nicely for putting away Cons: Learning curve, my lil guy just turned 3 thou. (very easy for his granny to use! hah) Overall a very neat and interesting toy! I like that it gets them up and moving around. I would buy for my friends' kids.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Both are still in great shape and there have been no trips to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Six kids under six years have been hopping around the house on a pair of these nearly every day since Christmas. Both are still in great shape and there have been no trips to the ER. Win/win.
customer_reviews.author: BackFatBarbie

customer_reviews.title: I love that it's built for wide spectrum of heights and ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a gift, and the recipient (a 3 year old) immediately took to it and was having a blast! I love that it's built for a wide spectrum of heights and weights—the whole family can jump in on the fun! (Sorry-couldn't resist the pun.) This will definitely be a go-to present for future gift giving.
customer_reviews.author: jimmythwack

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Our little Granddaughter, got the hang of this right away, she got it on her 3rd birthday!
customer_reviews.author: peachrj

customer_reviews.title: Well made and seems safe
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun for the 5 year old and his grandfather. The two year old keeps trying and can at least stand on it. It squeaks and the dogs go nuts trying to play too.
customer_reviews.author: Patcake

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for indoor and out door healthy fun.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son's 3rd birthday the product looks great the colors are sharp and vibrant, quality is amazing too. My son opened up the package and started jumping with it immediately and learned how to use it right away. We love this toy and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: moses lipschitz

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: The product is otherwise fine and my son enjoyed it until he fell face first on the handle bar. What should be only a bruise and user error resulting in seeing a doctor and getting liquid stitches to his face. The problem is the paw patrol figure on the center of the handle is attached to the handle bar with a metal C wire. When depressed on the ground (as is the case when a child falls), the rigid medal wire protrudes. When my son hit his face on the handle, he received a deep laceration. Why they didn’t use a piece of plastic instead of the wire is beyond me. Accordingly, I would NOT buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: lynb99

customer_reviews.title: Fun, takes time to get hang of
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Good quality. I was afraid it was going to be cheaply made but it’s wasnt. Both my kids like this and haven’t gotten the hang of jumping and balancing but are trying I think they have more fun when I try it out and then they laugh and really want to try it on their own. It does make the squeaky sound when you weight enough and jump not like my 2 year old who just stand on it. Lol It takes time to get the hang of it for younger kids even for my 5 year old but I like that it teaches balance and fun for inside on rainy, cold or snowy days.
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: Pointless
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old was not impressed. I got it because it seems safer then a regular Pogo stick, but when you jump on it you don’t go any higher then you would if you were on the ground. The foam yoga brick that you stand on doesn’t bounce. Needless to say this just collects dust in the playroom.
customer_reviews.author: cici

customer_reviews.title: Broken after first use.
customer_reviews.text: Really bummed about this. Picture attached shows what happened after my 35lb 3 year old used it for the first time.... On carpet... Only a matter of time before that chunk falls off... Update: I contacted customer service and they were prompt to address the defective Hopper. I am currently awaiting the replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Fun Old-School-esque Toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these. One for my 2 godsons and one for my son (ages 3, 5 and 5). They really liked them! I can definitely see how this can help coordination and be lots of fun. Besides it's a nice break from technology and definitely safe to play indoors. I tried it out myself-to make sure it was safe ;-). Will be buying one for my niece (4 yes old) as well.
customer_reviews.author: Shavonta Green

customer_reviews.title: Broke - Flybar My First Foam Pogo Jumper
customer_reviews.text: I bought two, one as a gift for my niece and the other for my daughter. The one I got for my daughter promptly broke within the first day of opening it. It was fun while it lasted, she loved the Flybar My First Foam Pogo Jumper, and was very disappointed when it broke. I already arranged for a refund and sent it back. I should have taken pictures of it, but I didn't think of it at the time. As far as I know, the one for my niece is still useable. Please someone fix the design, its a great idea for a toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great birthday gift for 4 to 8 year olds
customer_reviews.text: I was happily astonished upon receipt of this pogo stick. It kept my four year old grandson busy for hours at a time during the bitter cold days of this holiday season. It is well made and adjustable as children grow in height. It encourages developing a fine sense of balance. The material is tough enough to withstand use Outdoors but gentle enough to be used on hardwood floors or rugs. It is a great birthday gift for any child 4 to 8 years old.
customer_reviews.author: frankie

customer_reviews.title: Jump counter was broken off
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these (one for my son and one for my nephew). The jump counter was broken off of one of them. Luckily that was the one I ended up giving to my son and not as a birthday gift to my nephew! My son doesn't care that the jump counter is broken but it irritated me that it didn't arrive in the condition it should have. He won't let me return it so we are keeping it. He does love to jump on it so for his sake it does deserve 5 stars. I think my sister was annoyed with the squeaker so hopefully it stops working soon as others have stated.
customer_reviews.author: TEXAS

customer_reviews.title: A great exercise for adults too!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 year old grandson, but after playing with it, saw what an amazing exercise piece it could be for adults. I bought one for myself and this thing does everything. You can stretch with it 10 different ways, helps with balance, strength building and even cardio when you jump with it. My trainer got a big kick out of it when I showed it to him. Sometimes, life gives us little surprises!!
customer_reviews.author: Armando Favazza

customer_reviews.title: The second one is holding up well and my children both enjoy it. I attempted to call and left messages ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these. One of the pogo's handles pulled off after 3 jumps. I had a very teary eyed little girl. The second one is holding up well and my children both enjoy it. I attempted to call and left messages with no return call from Flybar's customer service.
customer_reviews.author: kristineg

customer_reviews.title: Squeak! Squeak!
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty simple toy, great for kids stuck in the house. Attached is a video of my (small) 5 year old enjoying it to the max. I didn't realize it came with a squeaky noise, you should be aware of it... I did this to myself.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Total failure
customer_reviews.text: Neither my kid nor any of her friends, aged 3 to 6, ever figured out how to use it. A total failure.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn Singer

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy for the littles
customer_reviews.text: My grandkids love this toy. It is great for younger ones who lack the coordination to use a true pogo stick. I would have given this five stars except that the thing squeaks like a wounded animal every time the kid jumps. It is totally annoying. But the grandson loved it and the grin on his face is worth the aggravation. The toy is durable for small kids and is sturdy. The handles are durable. Bouncing around keeps kids busy. I am pleased with this toy...except for that squeak.
customer_reviews.author: J.C. Keller

customer_reviews.title: A hit!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday gift for a 5-year-old boy. He loves it! And since the weight limit on it is so high, everybody can use it! My husband had a great time chasing the kids through the house on it, too. It'll take some practice, but after only ten minutes or so of practice, the 5-year-old was able to jump a dozen times or more at once. I recommend practicing either outside on grass, or on a carpeted floor, because the bottom part will slide out from underneath the user on hardwood or linoleum, and you're likely to fall right onto your tailbone.
customer_reviews.author: ElysianLove88

customer_reviews.title: This little toy brought joy to my very tall 6 year old daughter for ...
customer_reviews.text: This little toy brought joy to my very tall 6 year old daughter for several weeks. Now, like all toys, it's no longer in the spotlight, but she lived on it for a few weeks. It's well made, versatile in that my 4 ft child can use it as do her shorter friends and we like to use it for games during homeschool. I'll have her "hop" to her lesson in a different room and get the wiggles out and she love to hop on it outside to chase the cat!
customer_reviews.author: newmama1

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for any age
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these for my son, niece, and nephews for a Christmas present and it was the biggest hit! They were aged from 3-8 and they all loved them equally. The 8 year old is autistic and his mother was thrilled at how much he was into this toy because he can be very selective but he loved this. It does have a squeak which I was afraid would get old but it really just adds to the fun. It was nice that we didn’t have to worry about batteries or recharging anything for the kids to enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: Sfurrow

customer_reviews.title: which is sad, because they really like them
customer_reviews.text: Two of my kiddos received one of these for Christmas and both have already torn, which is sad, because they really like them!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. And so is my son
customer_reviews.text: Within 4 days of having this product it broke. The squeaky thing inside of it broke off and now it doesn't bounce right. Very 😔
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The kids love them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 6, 1 for each of my bouncing grandchildren. They love them. They had bouncing races, and are looking forward to playing with them outside once it warms up. Me too...I forgot that they have squeakers in them. Although one of the kids bounced so much that the squeaker only squeaks on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri Heanue

customer_reviews.title: It seemed quite hard to operate for two three year olds even myself , maybe for older kids
customer_reviews.text: Maybe because of the light weight of the product, my child and her friend both have trouble balancing and stay on top of the foam. Both are good at balancing from gym and ballet. I even tried it myself. I'd say don't get it until kids are older. Also return will cost around $6. So better try it out a store maybe before deciding to buy one.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: ☹️ Not fun for kids or adults. LITERALLY: 1. You might as well give your kids a pair of soft sneakers, 2. and make them hold a stick, 3. and connect the sneakers and stick with a big rubber band, 4. and tell them to go jump around. CONCLUSION: A waste of money and enthusiasm.
customer_reviews.author: Reading&Writing

customer_reviews.title: #grammawin!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 1/2 year old grandson for Christmas. It was a win! All 3 kids wanted to play with it. My almost 5 year old granddaughter picked up on how to jump on it right away. They loved the counter. I didn’t read close enough and I wasn’t expecting it to squeak every time they jumped like it did. But my daughter took the squeakers out, no problem. She was afraid the dog would think it’s a toy and destroy it if it squeaked. I was happy they liked it so much. It looks sturdy enough to last for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley H

customer_reviews.title: Your child will enjoy all while driving parents up a wall
customer_reviews.text: This thing was so weird to me but my children loved it I guess because of the squeaker in it it annoyed me so bad but again he loved it not I say it weird because I thought it was going to be like on a pole or something but it like a jump rope kinda string and that was new the squeaky thing had my dog going nuts as it did me I didn't get the reason for that but I mean for the price I can't fuss to much but it is definitely easy to tear up my son pop the rope and don't hit the squeak out
customer_reviews.author: Anthionia cuffee

customer_reviews.title: and he loved it. The first few times
customer_reviews.text: We were able to watch our grandson open this on Facetime, and he loved it. The first few times, he could not balance on it (just turning 3), but he laughed and his parents showed him how to put his feet further onto the jumper. He was soon able to jump several times, much to his delight. The next morning, his mom sent us a picture of him SLEEPING WITH IT - yes, I think it was a big hit!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected... not what I paid for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as 4th birthday gift for my boy.. I could have chosen his favorite color which is cheaper but without the counter and doesn’t light up, but my boy not only loves to jump, but also likes to count and likes anything that lights up so I thought this was perfect. Big mistake! It only lights up when it’s being dropped on floor/ground and not while he’s jumping. Another disappointment is after a couple of days, the counter broke. So really, I paid extra for nothing. I gave 2stars because jumper itself seems sturdy. He doesn’t really play with it for long period— 30min a day is the max. But this is not what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Mamamaria

customer_reviews.title: Squeaker breaks very easily=sad toddler
customer_reviews.text: We got the flybar my first foam pogo jumper for our 3 year old’s birthday. Unfortunately after an hour of on and off play the squeaker stopped making noise. Now our 3 year old has declared this toy broken and refuses to use it anymore. We have tried what we can to convince her that it still works to jump on but she has made up her mind. We are disappointed especially because she got about 20 hops of use out of the toy.
customer_reviews.author: Mrseyepokerouter

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: Santa came to our home on Christmas Eve to visit our 5 great grandchildren. He gave one of these to each of the 3 boys, ages 10, 6 and 4. They were the hit of the night! Even our 24 year old granddaughter was bouncing around on one! No one had a problem with figuring out how it worked. Great product! Since they just got them, I don’t know how sturdy they are or how long they’ll hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Saleslady

customer_reviews.title: great to for all ages but the squeaker has to go
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these for my three grandkids ages 8,6,2 1/2 they all like it very much but my daughter in law was not happy with me... seems the squeaker sound that it makes is very hard to handle especially with three of them. But even with only one it is to much.. it should be either omitted or able to remove. Also please take in mind, many houses have dogs.. and this sound will drive them crazy as well and will even make it a worse situation. If I knew it had a squeaky sound before I bought them (I did not read enough) I would not have bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Luciano

customer_reviews.title: Weight limit is legit. Makes a great i side toy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's 5th bday. He's having a difficult time trying to learn to use it but his 7 yr old cousin and myself were able to use it immediately. I weigh well over 200lbs so the 250lb limit is legitimately true. It'll take a younger kid some practice but it's a fun toy and good excersize. Idk if Id use it outside because I think the concrete would ruin the foam so this may just be an inside toy but that's okay, my son is always bored on rainy days looking for something to do so this works for that.
customer_reviews.author: Box

customer_reviews.title: Some love it some store it
customer_reviews.text: I can't really give great feed back due to the kid saying "cool" and then throwing it in the corner where its been for over 9 months. Durability is as expected with no issues. Ours had a squeeky "thing" so every time she jumped around on it, it sounded like a dog toy. It didn't peak her interest, but who says that your kid wont love it! Some kids eat boggers, while others cry because they got dirt on their hands. Not all kids are they same.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: I love that she can hop inside and out
customer_reviews.text: My 6yr. old daughter just received this as a gift. After a few attempts, the wide, thick bottom made her feel secure. I love that she can hop inside and out, and the material with which it was made from, will not damage furniture or hurt her. Mom and dad tried it out at first to show how it works and it held us with with ease. Her confidence grew with each hop and now, her friends are able to use it as well without falling down. I definitely reccomend this product for even a 3 yr old. It is so light and can be stored under their bed. Purchase one and watch the smiles begin.
customer_reviews.author: Kami L

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas present my son intercepted from Amazon and I'm weak, so he got to keep it. He caught on right away and immediately started bouncing around the house. We have tile and carpet and it works well on both. I took it over to my sister's to decorate cookies and it was a hit with older kids and adults. The older kids popped the squeeker, but no one is complaining. It's been great for an inside activity to burn off energy during winter days. I would not only recommend, but I wish I would have gotten one for my niece too.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Indoor/outdoor IMO -As advertised, seems safe
customer_reviews.text: We have those weird rubbery type floors that our cheap apartment complex put in. They are really big stickers but look like wood. So, it not hard or tile flooring. That being said: this toy seems safe for indoor use, as long as they are in a room or space where stuff won't be knocked down. I was under the impression this would strictly be an outside toy, but I think it's okay for both. It seems sturdy and I tested it out before giving it to my 5 year old who likes it but will need a while to get the hang of it. WAY safer than a regular pogo stick.
customer_reviews.author: A Phi

customer_reviews.title: My grandaughter loves it! ~Tami Wagoner, McAlester, OK
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 2 year-old granddaughter and she LOVES it. She is still a little light weight and cannot make it squeak when she jumps on it - but she's getting there. Good quality and will last until she can make it squeak. On the other hand - I'm large enough to make it squeak. LOL. I played with it more on Christmas Day than she did. LOL. (I'm not gonna tell you my weight but it's between one and two bills). It is sturdy enough for a grown adult to jump on it. It was a lot of fun. ~Tami Wagoner, McAlester, OK
customer_reviews.author: TAMI WAGONER

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it does, great for indoors
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy for indoor play if you don't have access to outside areas (probably good outdoors too-but I bought it for indoor use). It took my 4 year old about 10 minutes to get the hang of it and he can bounce down the hallway and around the living room with the soft foam not harming a thing. I get him to use it by challenging him to different things like, "I bet you can't bounce down the hallway and back." I bet with two kids you could really get creative and them competitive and get them to burn energy.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia S

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for kids! But be careful not to get too rough.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two, one came first and the kids loved it. The squeaking is a little too loud inside the house so it’s better when it’s outside. The kids are all under the age of 10 (the youngest being 2) but they all loved jumping around on it, though I suggest not being too rough on it, after a week of the kids playing on it all day, the handle came out and smacked one of the kids in the face. She was fine but I had to rip out one of the squeakies to shove the handle back in, it seemed to work fine but had to warn them not to pull too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great starter pogo
customer_reviews.text: My son (4 years old) had been asking for a pogo stick for 2 months and I decide to buy this one. He's never had one so I figured this would be perfect for him to learn on. It will take some time for the child to balance and keep a steady rhythm jumping, at least for my son it did. It does squeak if that bothers some parents. He's even jumped in the house with it and since it is soft on the bottom I could care less. I'm not worried about it messing up the floors.
customer_reviews.author: renae

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong, they love it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 3 and 7 year old. Both loved it. They played with them all day on christmas. Today, March 21, 2020 they're both still going strong. No problems, still intact, great quality and fun for both. I highly recommend this. BUT, if they're "bigger" kids, meaning they weigh more than normal for their ages, they may not perform as well. Some friends with "heavier" kids of the same ages tried them, with less fun results. Just being honest. I'd buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Jim from Ky.

customer_reviews.title: Safe Physical giggling fun!!
customer_reviews.text: While my soon to be three year old nephew was kinda scared kinda frustrated with this at first that has changed. My niece let us know he is loving it now and bouncing Tigger like all over the house and giggling uncontrollably while doing so!! It is safe physical fun. Hard to find something like that these days!
customer_reviews.author: OKintheStix

customer_reviews.title: Very Fun But I'd Say 4 & Up
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my 5.5 year old. She is in love. She caught on very fast and is enjoying herself. It's a great outlet for her energy in the winter. My 3 year old tried maybe once or twice. He couldn't do it and he gave up. It does not seem like he has the coordination. I don't know why it says 3+. I would have bought him something else. I feel bad he can't enjoy it. Product still gets 5 stars because it is well made and sturdy. Even I jumped on it and I'm almost 5'7. The bungee does stretch.
customer_reviews.author: LuppaMom

customer_reviews.title: For the super active five year old who has EVERYTHING....
customer_reviews.text: ....but he doesn't have THIS play toy! The Flybar My First Foam Pogo Jumper Flashing LED Lights & Pogo Counter Safe Pogo Hopper is unique, and ideal for a high energy boy like my soon to be 5 year old grandson! I mean, he hops down the stairs, hops on his bed, hops on the sofa....why not get him a toy that makes hopping even MORE fun, with flashing lights and squeaky noises! Can't wait to see him open this gift in August and try it out! I usually get him books, so this will be a surprise, as well! He can even watch a video on YouTube to see what he can do with this toy!
customer_reviews.author: Rozaway

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 4 year old son and while he was jumping the foam broke the squeaker stopped working (which I’m not upset about, kinda glad it stopped squeaking) but I feel like I could have probably been able to find something else to spend my money other than this product that broke a couple of days after it was given to him.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this product but unfortunately it did not meet my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this product but unfortunately it did not meet my expectations. I purchased this for my very energetic 3 year old son. At first he had trouble staying on top of it and keeping his balance, since the bottom is not very sturdy. Once he figure it out, he used it a handful of times before the handle just snapped out of the base and he ended up on his back. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for my 3yr old grandson
customer_reviews.text: This could definitely be enjoyed by kids several years older than my 3yr old grandson, and it does take some practice to figure out - but he is getting the hang of it - and what great fun! It seems well-built and I imagine will be fun for his friends to try, as well. A good value for a toy that helps with coordination and balance, is well made, and is loads of fun! (best to start out on carpeted floors, esp for young ones, to soften mis-jumps while learning!)
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Wilson

customer_reviews.title: One thousand nopes.
customer_reviews.text: I am so confused by the rave reviews for this toy? I purchased this for my four-year-old niece. She opened it, was excited by the pink color, attempted to use it, couldn't, gave up. I attempted to use it and gave up. Someone else tried it out and then also gave up. Super disappointed. It's essentially a piece of foam on a rubber band that you can stand on.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlea

customer_reviews.title: tons of fun!!
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my 3 year old grandaughter. she absolutley loved it along with her 6 and 7 year old siblings. they took turns trying to jump hard enough to get it to squeak 30 yo old dad and 23yo uncle also took turns. way better than i thought because i thought there was a metal bar i was afraid may hurt them if they fell but its all soft one piece no putting together anything i highly recommend for the price and huge amount of fun had by everyone in a short amount of time
customer_reviews.author: R. McKay

customer_reviews.title: Had my daughter enjoy her toy outside
customer_reviews.text: My daughter picked this out. She’s very active however she’s pretty tall for her age. She was skeptical at first since she didn’t want to have to grouch down. The band handle is perfect since it stretches. The annoying part for me it’s the squeak with every single jump she does. It drove me nuts after two days. The bottom part is foam which she loves because she can do it barefoot but the sound that comes from it gets old fast.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: This is not a pogo stick...
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to get my 4 year old nephew his first pogo stick for Christmas. When he opened it and I realized it's just a box attached to a giant rubberband attached to handles I was heartbroken. He tried to jump a few times but it is hard for him to pull up the handlebars and jump at the same time...
customer_reviews.author: Jackiediane

customer_reviews.title: It is exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter who is turning 4. She is very athletic and goes gymnastics. Still, there is a learning curve for her with this product. I think it has to do with her size and weight. She is strong but small. Her 9 year old sister was able to use it immediately. I have no doubt that the 4 year old will be able to use it, as she said, "When I get the hang of it". I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charm C

customer_reviews.title: Very fun toy for inside or out.
customer_reviews.text: My niece loved it! I bought this for a birthday gift. Out of the mountain of toys her party produced, this was the first thing she picked up and played with. It's simple, yet fun for a 4 year old. Even her 2 year brother was able to hop a few times on it.
customer_reviews.author: JTB

customer_reviews.title: Not for small children as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Advertisement shows a small 3 or 4?year old boy bouncing on it so I bought this for my 4 year old grandson. He is small however the foam block was not dense enough to support his weight and gave way every time he tried to jump on it. It kept throwing him off and at one point, he almost fell into a table although our family room is large. This toy is not appropriate for children this age as most have not developed their coordination skills
customer_reviews.author: ewear

customer_reviews.title: 4-year-old loves it. Counter is useless.
customer_reviews.text: My just turned 4-year-old got the hang of this pretty quickly and has fun counting his jumps and trying to get more each time. His visiting friends and siblings have enjoyed taking turns, too. I should have just gone for the no lights, no counter option since the counter adds multiple counts per jump and fell off within a few days. The lights are unnecessary and the jumper cannot enjoy them while jumping since they are off to the side of the handles. A great first "pogo stick" for a younger child.
customer_reviews.author: luv great kids books

customer_reviews.title: Disapointing product don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I now got time to write a review. This is a horrible product. My son was almost seriously hurt. I ordered the toy as a Christmas gift for my son. It was sent via my skybox. We left the country for vacation. He only opened it when we returned on January 6. My son literally played with it for 15 minutes then it broke.
customer_reviews.author: JINELLE CHARLES

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable and hysterical toy
customer_reviews.text: This is way easier than learning how to use a pogo stick for both my 5 and 6 year old. I liked that even I could use it to demonstrate it to them. The foam base does make it a little wobbly but I think it helps to improve their balance. The best feature to the kids (and worst for the parents) would have to be the squeakers, it cracks the kids up everytime though so I tolerate it.
customer_reviews.author: FryIvy

customer_reviews.title: It's Ella Rose's 4th Birthday & She Won't Stop Pogo-Jumping!
customer_reviews.text: I worried that this might be difficult for a 4 year old to master, but, after 15 minutes of gentle coaching (keep your feet close to the center, jump at the same time you pull the handle up) our little Ella Rose was able to jump in place. She jumped for 2.5 hours non-stop & learned to go forward before bedtime. She would not stop! She was a little sweat-ball of pogo happiness & she slept really well! lol
customer_reviews.author: L. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money for the flashing lights and counter. Stick to the cheaper regular one.
customer_reviews.text: Opened box to it already blinking so when my son used it only one side of the flashing lights worked. Hour later other side stopped blinking. Second day of having it the counter broke off.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Krick

customer_reviews.title: Safe and sturdy for all age kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 yr old grandson. He couldn't wait to try it. It was great that all he had to do is take it out of the packaging and start jumping - nothing to put together. His older siblings, ages 9 and 12, also enjoyed jumping around the house. Even a grammy can do it! The squeak may annoy parents but my grandson loved making it squeak, although he is small enough that he cannot make it squeak yet when he jumps on it! This is the second time I've purchased this product, and it was a hit both times.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Blower

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work/flimsy and waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Huge let down!!!! It is a Waste of money and doesn’t work, this should not even be an item on amazon... bought for my Nefuew and he tried to jump with it but it just flopped down... two thumbs down. Picture and description are completely misleading
customer_reviews.author: DonnaTello

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to buy this after reading some reviews. I got it for my three year old grandson, and he really likes it. It does require practice, and balance, but he caught on very quickly, and enjoys it. It doesn’t allow for big jumps, which would’ve been more fun, but he didn’t seem to mind the rather small hops. Not sure why the rope part connected to the handle, isn’t a solid part, but it seems to work out ok.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Squeaking isn’t loud, it’s lots of fun, adults can use it too.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one (orange and teal) bc all the other reviews for other colors said this one was the sturdiest and well-made, which seems to be true. Adults can use this too and it’s a lot of fun to be able to play and take turns with the kids on this. I thought the squeaking would be annoying and was preparing to have to disassemble that part, but it’s not loud or bad at all. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toy, great value!
customer_reviews.text: Living in Alaska, we have to find physical activities for the kids inside, that won’t wreck the house. My grandchildren are five and seven, and have a great time jumping in the living room. It makes a small squeak as they jump, so you can count their best jumps in a row. They really enjoy it, and it’s healthy exercise when it’s too cold to go outside. I’m sure that these toys will be fun in the yard, during our short summer, too.
customer_reviews.author: chilly shopper

customer_reviews.title: Fun and good exercise!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my 4 and 8 year old granddaughters. They love them! The 4 year old couldn't do it at first but by the end of the first day, she had it down. We haven't had them very long but they seem to be well made. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: cupcake

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Omg these kids went crazy on this thing. They were very rough (ages 7-12) so I'm not shocked that the green foam that meets the bottom of the block ripped. Their feet kept stepping on it wrong. Didn't stop its function one bit. Used it outside and indoors so it scraped across the concrete also. My nephew loved his birthday gift and that's what matters.
customer_reviews.author: MDN

customer_reviews.title: Better than the original
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 for the Grandkids and they love them! We had the old type pogo sticks with our kids and they commented on how they would have loved to have these instead. They hold adults too up to 250 lbs and are really a fun thing for the whole family, if you are on the shorter side. They look as if they will hold up for a long time. Very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Kids LOVE this
customer_reviews.text: The 8 year old began jumping right away. The 3 year old could hop once and the next hop was off, BUT she kept on trying. She will get it yet! Both are very active and will use them a lot. The squeek is a tiny bit irritating, but not too bad. Their mom just shrugged when I was worried about it. This is a fun toy and keeps them active.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. West

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Not happy. Our petite 4 year old only used for a few months and the black piece in between the handlebars broke 😫
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Arevalo

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves frogs so that was the draw in purchasing this. The frog one is cute! She's 4 and can only hop about 5 times before sort of falling off. She's not the most coordinated child though lol. I think she will get better with it as she gets older. I'm 31, 5'4, 120lbs and I can do it! I thought I'd be too big, but works fine. It would probably wear out easily if I did it often. Overall very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Fun, Helps Promote Exercise
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift to a 5 year old. The mom said he was pleasantly surprised that it squeaked when he jumped on it. She mentioned this was the best gift ever for "the kid that won't stop jumping." When I asked the child if he used it and liked it, he was all excited and said "YES!' I may consider buying a few more for the other boys if I see this works out good. Thank you for excellent service and the price was great!
customer_reviews.author: B.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great fun/exercise for kids!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for six-year-old grandson. He was on it in seconds and having a great time. I like that he can play on it in the house or outside. Also it makes a good exercise for me - like a rowing bar. Could do without the squeaker.
customer_reviews.author: Mrspiano

customer_reviews.title: Good times
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter’s 5th birthday. Of course the first couple of tries were awkward but she picked it up quickly and is now able to jump all around the house. I even tried it and I weigh 180lbs. It was easy and fun. I’m hoping the squeak will malfunction soon! It’s actually not too annoying but I am very happy with the purchase. It was one of her favorite gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Grier

customer_reviews.title: A great buy, would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! We got one for.my 4 year old and one for my nine year old. My nine year old pretty much got it right away. It took my 4 year old a few tries but he figured it ot rather quickly as well. They spend hours on their logos. I tried it myself and we had fun racing across the yard. Might need to get 2 more so we can all race!
customer_reviews.author: kolohe

customer_reviews.title: Not noisy indoors.
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it - this was a gift and kids from 2 to 11 are loving it. 2 yo will do better in a year or so, but he can't hurt himself trying. The other kids have a good time as do their friends. It was a great gift. Parents are grateful because the things are foam, therefore quiet. Kids, of course are as noisy as always.
customer_reviews.author: Hoody

customer_reviews.title: Fun and safte toy!
customer_reviews.text: A 5 and 7 year old enjoyed this, they're too young and not heavy enough for pogo sticks, not to mention the safety factor, these are a great alternative, the squeak can get on your nerves after a while but overall both of them loved jumping all over the house with them, recommend as a great way to burn energy!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my 8 and 3-year-old boys for Christmas. They enjoy them and think it is fun but do not use it for long. I, however, have been using it more than them. It's a lot of fun, and a great workout for the back of my legs. I'm 5'4" 120lbs and it is no problem for me to use. The squeaker is cute and not annoying imo. Both have held up to my use so far!
customer_reviews.author: Kh1982

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't make a loud noise. Very nice toy for kid with energy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy. Some of the reviews said it made a noise that drove them crazy. This toy doesn't make a loud noise it goes bong bong bong low not loud. It's not louder than any of our learning toys. I use it and I'm 61! I am short though. Actually grandkids get a kick out of watching me. Pretty well made I'm 140 lbs! Seems like it's going to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Momma T

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old LOVES this. She has us count her hops and loves when she gets going enough to make it squeak. I love that she is getting exercise, and that it’s a safe toy. It works on hard floors or carpet. My 5 year old also likes to use this from time to time when his sister will let him have a turn. Overall, this is a great toy and I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: MLO123

customer_reviews.title: A Lot of Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife, mainly as a joke. But it's great! She is no light-weight and this easily can take it. At first, she didn't realize you are supposed to stretch the handle up, which made it even funnier. The squeak is both hilarious and annoying. We will give it to our grandson. Great for indoor use on a raining, "there's nothing to do" day. Since it is mostly made of foam, I don't think it would last long for adult weight.
customer_reviews.author: ElbeauTop Contributor: BBQ Styles

customer_reviews.title: Happily Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my seven year old son. I didn't want to get a full blown pogo stick just yet since he's never used one. My son and I both love this. The strap stretches easily for an older child to use it. He took it outside and was thrilled; bouncing up and down and even had fun falling. I highly recommend this for any child of any age. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flybar My First Foam Pogo Jumper for Kids Fun and Safe Pogo Stick for Toddlers,
customer_reviews.text: This flybar is a great idea but it is not working out for us. My daughter is 5. She is very active. She is good at gymnastic and other activities. She is having a hard time getting the grip of this thing. I think that it is simply not stable enough. She fall a couple of times very bad. The quality is not as good as I was expecting. I'm thinking in returning this now. All an all I think that this is a good idea but at the same time it is dangerous for toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pogo for 3YO
customer_reviews.text: 3 YO granddaughter saw a Pogo stick on her favorite cartoon show and wanted one. We knew a traditional Pogo stick would not be age appropriate and would only frustrate her. We found this on Amazon, and we're very happy that we bought it because she learned to use it very quickly and now is bouncing all over the house.
customer_reviews.author: Bob E.

customer_reviews.title: Learning required
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Durable Cons: Hard to learn for 4 year old It says 3 years and up but it seems difficult for my son to grasp. I thought it was easy for him to learn but so far it’s been tough. We’ll be spending more time with him to get it right. Don’t expect your kid to be a natural and allow time to get it down.
customer_reviews.author: Sun Y

customer_reviews.title: No thanks
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t a huge fan of this. My 3 year old who is very tall for her age can’t even use it. I thought the handle was gonna be like your traditional pogo stick. I didn’t realize they’re bands so it doesn’t sit up straight. Cool idea with the squeaker in it, but as a parent I can barely stand that noise from my dog or any other toy. We’ll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen L

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy for kids
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We've only had it for a few days. I was concerned it might be too small for my 9 year old son but he can use it no problem! My daughter who is 12, tall and weighs around 125lbs can use it also with no issues. It squeaks (which they love! Me not so much lol,) it helps them burn off energy, is safe enough to use in the house and priced right. It's a win win in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I gave three of this jumping toy to a family with children aged 2 to 6, for Christmas. They loved it. The 2-year-old was not yet ready for it, which I expected based on the 3+ recommendation, but I gave him one so he wouldn’t feel left out. I especially liked the exercise factor, that the children could be active indoors during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Anne D

customer_reviews.title: Fun intent, but squeak function requires too much weight.
customer_reviews.text: This 'pogo stick' is designed for little kids, but you need a significant amount of weight to get it to bounce up and squeak. Seems like under 75 lb doesn't bounce much or create a squeak, which is a bummer since this was purchased for my 3 year old. She has fun with it, but wishes it functioned for her lighter weight.
customer_reviews.author: Ayrn

customer_reviews.title: Difficult for my 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: My grandbaby is 3 years old and the size is great but it's difficult to use mostly because it doesn't bounce very high so the learning curve is a bit longer. It made her not want to use it for a while but she would go back to it from time to time and finally she learned how to do it but she doesn't play with it very much because it doesn't bounce very well.
customer_reviews.author: misty mangrum

customer_reviews.title: So cute
customer_reviews.text: Got for my 3 year old granddaughter. She hasn't quite mastered it yet, but loves the unicorn design. Her 4 year old sister picked it up right away and loves to use it. Just purchased it recently so I can't speak to the longevity of it, but it seems sturdy enough. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for children under one meter tall.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 98 cm tall, 16 kg, and three years old. Her height has always been leading among children of the same age, BUT this toy is still too high to her, and the spring rope can't adjust the length, Very bad .Because the rope is too long, she can't pull the elastic rope up hard, so you can imagine that it can't spring at all. Not suitable for children under one meter tall.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

product_meta.title: Flybar My First Foam Pogo Jumper for Kids Fun and Safe Pogo Stick, Durable Foam and Bungee Jumper for Ages 3 and up Toddler Toys, Supports up to 250lbs (Blue)
feature_bullets: BOING, BOING, SQUEAK; The My First Flybar foam pogo stick is hours of healthy, bouncy fun. Crafted from durable foam, this is an ideal first pogo stick for kids; each jump makes a fun squeaky sound destined to delight

USE ANYWHERE; We’ve designed our kids jumper for indoor and outdoor use, the heavy duty components will withstand all conditions and unlike inferior jumping toys, this pogo jumper for kids is made to last! A great boys or girls toy for ages 3 and up!

TRAIN BALANCE; Pogo sticks make great active toys for kids because they help train hand eye coordination and gross motor skills; Give your kid a headstart in life with a toddler pogo stick crafted to improve balance
HEALTHY; Get your kid off the sofa with a jumping toy that encourages fitness; Our bungee jumper is a foam pogo stick that promotes healthy activity whilst being incredible bouncy boing fun

MANUFACTURER PROMISE; At Flybar, we pride ourselves on seamless customer service; If you don’t love our foam pogo jumper, simply return it within 30 days for a total refund; No fuss, no tricks, just incredible service you can trust

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars8,949 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
